title: The Negotiation
description: Dwight saves Jim from an attack by Roy, but Dwight won't allow Jim to thank him for it. Meanwhile, Darryl asks Michael for a pay raise, and Michael discovers that he is woefully underpaid--so Michael goes to headquarters to ask for one himself.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: So do you want to see it or not?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don't know.  Feel like... Friday night crowds...

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Oh my God, you're like, agoraphobic.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Agoraphobic?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Yeah!  You would rather sit on your couch and watch a Phillies game, than go out to a movie with your awesome girlfriend.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Absolutely correct.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Later, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Kev, have a good weekend.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Bye.  Ok, so this is what's gonna happen.  You're gonna suck it up.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Here we go...

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: ...and we're gonna go to dinner.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok...

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: And then we're gonna go to the movies.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sounds good.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Hey Halpert!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey... [Roy lunges towards Jim]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: ROY!

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: [shrieks]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Roy don't! [Dwight pepper-sprays Roy]

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: [screams in pain] Ahh God!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pam, please call security!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Everyday, for eight years, I have brought pepper spray into this office to protect myself and my fellow employees.  And everyday, for eight years, people have laughed at me.  Well, who's laughing now? [Dwight blinks and winces in pain from the pepper spray]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No need for consternation, everything is under control.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael, last Friday one of your employees attacked another employee in your office!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It was a crime of passion, Jan, not a disgruntled employee. Everyone here is extremely gruntled.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [sigh] Is Toby there?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I'm... here, Jan.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Ok, what... what is the situation Toby?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Well, we fired Roy, obviously.  And Jim won't press charges against Roy or the company.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Thank God.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah, um, but now apparently Darryl has some issue with his...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, he has been wanting a raise for a couple of months and he's just using this Roy thing as leverage.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: All right, well are you gonna take care of this?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeppers.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What did I tell you about "yeppers?"

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't... remember.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I told you not to say it.  Do you remember that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeesh...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I really don't want to talk about it.  I don't mean to be rude, but I just... I don't want to comment on what happened.  It sucked.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I guess... all things considered, I was lucky Dwight was there.  And Roy was lucky that Dwight only used pepper spray.  And not the nunchucks or the throwing stars.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey man, I never got a chance to thank you... for stopping Roy.  Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you not necessary and thus, not accepted.  I saw someone breaking the law and I interceded.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.  Um... Got you something.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Don't want it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You don't know what it is.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Don't want it.  Won't open it.  Don't need it.  Won't take it.  Citizens do not accept prizes for being citizens.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It was a little glass display case for his for his bobblehead.  That would have made us even, I think.  He saves my life, I get him a box for his desk toy.  Even Steven.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, don't call me a hero.  Do you know who the real heroes are?  The guys who wake up every morning, and go into their normal jobs, and get a distress call from the commissioner, and take off their glasses and change into capes and fly around fighting crime.  Those are the real heroes.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Angela, Roy's check.  He's coming in later to pick it up.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Man, I cannot believe I missed the fight.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It was crazy.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You saw it?  Describe it please.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Well, I heard some shouting.  And I look over and Roy's by reception and you could just tell he's gonna punch somebody.  Jim says something.  Roy stomps over there.  All of the sudden, BAM.  Roy goes down, and Dwight's standing there like an action hero.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It was insane!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [flustered] Well... good for Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok I want you to be Darryl and ask me for a raise, because I want to try out some of these negotiation tactics on you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Where'd you get that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wikipedia.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wikipedia... is the best thing ever.  Anyone in the world can write anything they want about any subject, so you know you are getting the best possible information.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, Darryl, ask me for a raise.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, Mike.  Since Roy left I've been doing a lot more work, and I need a raise.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hmm, well that's interesting Darryl.  I think... [mumbling softly] that maybe you should... [mumbling jibberish]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I can't hear you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What I'm saying is that, [continues to mumble jibberish]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Still nothin'.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, see what I did?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: By leaning back, and by whispering, I established a dominant physical position.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, let's try another one.  Um...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Walking out of the room unexpectedly.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And what happens in this one?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's a surprise.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Go ahead, ask me for a raise.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Can I have a raise?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [gets up and begins to walk out of the room]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [softly] Sex, Steve Martin, Terri Hatcher.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, what did you say?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I didn't say anything.  I was waiting to see what happened.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh it... sounded interesting... what you were gonna...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I saw the perpetrator advance toward the victim at a high rate of speed.  His head was thrown back, his shoulder and arm cocked indicating an attack position.  Perp grabbed the victim.  I removed my weapon from its secure hiding place.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Which is where?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Irrelevant.  Discharged it at a distance of a little over a meter into the perpetrator's eyes, nose, and face area.  Rendering him utterly and completely disabled.  Then I contacted the authorities.  The end.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Thanks Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: That is the bravest thing I have ever heard.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I can't imagine what I would have done.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I can.  You would have left me to fend for myself.  Like that time we were on the Ferris Wheel and that kid dropped a milk shake on me and you just laughed.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Well that was funny, that's why.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh it was?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Okay, well the next time that you get scared, that you think a murderer's in your apartment in the middle of the night...

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: ...and you call me, to calm you down...

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You know what?  I didn't--

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Can you stop...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: ...you can just call somebody else 'cause I'm not gonna do it anymore, Ryan.  I'm not.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: There's a bunch of people back here, maybe...

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Well, don't talk to me about calling people in the middle of the night...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Guys...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I call you in the middle of the night to tell you that I love you!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I don't think Michael intended to punish me, by putting Ryan back here with Kelly.  But, if he did intend that?  Wow.  Genius.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [knock on door] Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You ready for me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, yeah, absolutely.  Have a seat.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Cool.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what?  Actually, let's go into the conference room.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, you know what?  Let's stay here.  No let's go... Yeah let's go to the conference room.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Tactic number six.  Change the location of the meeting at the last second.  Totally throws 'em off.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Number 14, declining to speak first.  Makes them feel uncomfortable, puts you in control.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [long pause] I am declining to speak first.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Okay, I'll start.  It's pretty simple really. I uh, I think I deserve a raise.  I'm scheduled to get one in six months, but I'd like that to be moved up to now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hmm.  Ohh, Darryl.  You are a good worker, and a good man.  I just, you know, times are tight.  And I just don't think corporate is going to go for this right now.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Are you wearin' lady clothes?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Are you wearin' lady clothes?  Those look like lady... pants.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, this is a power suit.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: That there's a woman's suit.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Darryl laughs] I do not buy woman's clothes.  I would not make that mistake again.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I'ma call Roy, man.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ohh... kay.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: This is gonna make him feel better.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: This is too good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright, you know what?  Pam, could you please tell Darryl that this is not a woman's suit?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my God, that's a woman's suit!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: You're wearing a woman's suit?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I do, I, I wear men's suits, OK?  I got this out of a bin.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There were these huge bins of clothes, and everybody was rifling through them like crazy, and I grabbed one.  And it fit!  So I don't think that this is totally just a woman's suit.  At the very least it's bisexual.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Who makes it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, [reading the inside of his jacket] MISSterious.  And it is mysterious because the buttons are on the wrong side... that's the mystery.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Look, it's got shoulderpads, and did you see that lining?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Did you see...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Would you stop it, please?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So, none of that tipped you off?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's European, OK?  It's a European cut.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, the pants don't have any pockets.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, they don't.  See?  [Michael lifts his jacket tail, sticks out his back side and shows Pam]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [Laughing, covering her mouth]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Italians don't wear pockets.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's been a really rough couple of days... This helps a little.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Hey, maybe you want to come over and raid my closet?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I don't want to do that because I'm twice your size anyway.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah, he look like Hillary Clinton.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um, let's just do this in 15 minutes.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Okay, can you just stand right there?  [snaps camera phone picture] I gotta send some e-mails.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Negotiations are all about controlling things.  About being in the driver's seat.  And make one tiny mistake, you're dead.  I made one tiny mistake.  I wore woman's clothes.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Karen, how do you feel that Roy tried to kick your boyfriend's ass over another woman?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: I feel great, Kevin.  Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: You must have been scared out of your mind.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Well, you know it happened so fast I didn't really have time to be scared.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What happened, exactly?  I wasn't here, so I haven't really heard the whole story.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Um, well, Jim and I were talking and Roy walked in looking super angry.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: And he's a big dude, you know?  And all of a sudden, Jim pushed me out of the way, and Roy cocked his fist, and then bam, Dwight sprays him and knocks him on his butt.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [flustered] Goodness.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: When I heard Jim and Pam had kissed, my reaction was to have lots of long talks with Jim about our feelings.  Roy just attacked him.  I'm not sure which one Jim hated more.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let's get down to business.  Why don't you tell me why you think you deserve a raise.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Well, it's simple Mike. I mean we merged these two branches right?  So now we're shipping twice as many orders as we used to.  With Roy gone we got a smaller crew.  And I'm pickin' up all of his slack, so I think I should be compensated fairly, by gettin' a raise.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [mumbles jibberish]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What?  I can't hear you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [mumbling softly] That was a very good point.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I can't-- what, Mike?  Are you--

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [mumbling softly] You make a very compelling argument.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sorry I almost got you killed.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, that was nuts.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: He could have broken your nose or something.  Crazy.  It's just so stupid.  I mean, getting back with Roy and everything.  I mean, what was I thinking, right?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, I mean, you guys really seem to have a strong connection.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Not anymore.  It's, um... It's completely over now.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We'll see.  I'm sure you guys will... find you way back to one another someday.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jim... I am really... sorry.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, yeah.  Don't worry about it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am going to give you a piece of paper.  I want you to write down how much you want, and I want you to slide it back across the desk to me.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Why can't I just... tell you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Because, that is the way these things are done.  In... films. [Darryl writes the amount and starts to hand the paper to Michael] No, slide-- slide it, yes.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: There you go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh. [scoffs] Come on.  Be serious.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I am serious, Mike.  That's a 10% raise.  That's what I want.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I... I can't give you that, I-- I don't make this much.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Come on, be for real Mike.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't.  Want me to prove it to you?  There is... a pay stub.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [laughs] Are you serious?  You're earning this?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Plus perks, yes.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Mike, this is barely more than I make.  You been here ten years, dog. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Fourteen years.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Ho-ho!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, please, please...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Oh, I'm sorry Mike, some of my folks got to hear about this one.  [texting on cell phone] Ah. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, let's take 15, again.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: A boss's salary isn't just about money, it is about perks.  It... for example, every year I get a $100 gas card... Can't put a price tag on that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok, if you don't want a gift, at least let me buy you a beer, or lunch or something.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: When Han Solo returns to the Death Star in the Millennium Falcon, and shoots down the TIE fighters and saves the Rebel cause, do you think he does so for a free beer?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Boy I--

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.  And why are you so interested in buying me something Jim, what's your angle?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's like when he annoys me and I want to screw with him to get him back, he never sees it coming.  But now, I want to be nice to him, and actually give him something, and he's like an eel.  I just can't grab onto him.  It's infuriating.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Maybe you just feel guilty about all the pranks.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well... yes, that's probably what it is.  So what do I do?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Hmm...  I don't know.  Maybe you should go back out there and sell paper so we can go on a trip.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Michael, here's the, uh, $15 I owe you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah.  I heard you might need it.  So...

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Here's the $40 you gave me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I didn't give you $40.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: In a way you did.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Yeah, I heard how much Michael makes.  I still think he's way overpaid.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [on cell phone] Fourteen years.  Fourteen.  I know.  [laughing]  Ok, alright.  I gotta go.  Later.  [hangs up]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.  Okay, here's the straight... dope.  No tricks.  No Wikipedia.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I talked to corporate, and they told me that I can only give you a 5% raise.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: That's 'cause of you, Mike.  They're not gonna give the workin' man more than the boss.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well what am I supposed to do?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Get your own raise.  You gotta get out there and earn, son.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm not gonna go out and ask for a raise right now.  That is ridiculous.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Well, when they merged the two branches together, they put you in charge.  Okay, and we're shippin' more now than we ever have.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [exhales] That's true.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah that's true.  You gotta call your girl, and get paid.  Show her who wears the pants in the relationship.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what?  I should.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah, you should.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have been a loyal employee for a long time.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Fourteen years long.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what?  I deserve a bump.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Make it happen, cap'in.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am makin' it happen, sergeant.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I remember it was very late at night, like 11, 11:30.  Big fella comes in screamin' about God knows what.  I think maybe Halpert had stolen his car.  [Angela rolls her eyes] Something like that.  So the big fella pulls out a sock filled with nickels.  Then Schrute grabs a can of hairspray and a lighter--

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You're useless.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Why don't we talk next month, after the quarter ends?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, Jan.  I've never asked for a raise in 14 years.  This is long overdue.  I wanna do it today.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Today.  All right, well, uh, if you want to do it today, we should meet in person, and uh, can you get here by five?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yshhyah.  Um, yeah.  I'll leave right away.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Great.  Uh, and listen.  Because of our, uh, our... you know, situation, we're gonna need to have a third party present.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, I'm bringing Darryl.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Da-- Darryl from the warehouse?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mm-hm.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No, Michael. We, we need an HR rep.  So, uh, I think you should just bring Toby.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, I'd rather kill myself.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael, he's your branch's HR rep...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [talking over Jan] No, Toby is terrible.  Toby is the worst human being I've ever known.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: ...and we need someone else, in the room, because of our relationship.  You know this.  Michael, either Toby comes with you, or we don't do it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sighs] Fine.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: You are so mean.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Yes you do, Ryan Bailey Howard.  You called me stupid.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No, I said your idea was stupid.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Toby, come on.  Let's go.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Where?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Where?  I'm gonna smack you in the head with a hammer.  Come on, let's go.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: What is so stupid about wanting to name a baby Usher?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Usher Jennifer Hudson Kapoor.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Don't you see why that's insane?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh, so I'm crazy now?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Comfortable, Mike?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.  Fine.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: How about you, man.  Comfortable?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [imitating Chris Tucker] Don't ever touch a black man's radio!  ...Chris Tucker.  Rush Hour.  I won't touch yours, by the way.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I haven't been to New York in a long time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mm, the Big Apple.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Maybe I'll stay overnight.  Got a cousin lives down there.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: How would we get home?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Oh you could stay too.  He's got a big place.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Maybe I'll stay.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Mm, it's not that big.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Busses, though.  They get you home quick.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [mouth full of pretzels] Oh, I...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: And all of a sudden, Dwight stood up and was like "No!"

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Then what'd he do? [Kelly's phone rings]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: You should just read the report that Toby did.  He took everyone's stories.  [answering phone] Dunder Mifflin, customer service, this is Kelly.  Oh yeah I could totally help you with that.  Ok, let me just get the folder out.  Okay, it seems here that you ordered 12,000 reams of paper.  Oh, 12 reams...

quotes.speaker: Hunter
quotes.text: Hey guys, Jan is ready for you.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Okay, bring it home now.  And don't forget the new black man phrase I taught you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pippity poppity, give me the zoppity.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yes sir.  Remember that.  I'll be right outside if you need me

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah, I taught Mike some new phrases.  I want him to get the raise, I... just can't help myself.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: [to Jim] Hey man, uh... I'm sorry. [Jim motions "Don't worry about it"] [Roy receives his check from Angela] Thanks. [to Pam] Can I, like, see you after work for coffee, or... something?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Please.  I just got some stuff I gotta say to you. [Pam nods, meekly]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [as Roy is walking out] Jim-- Roy-- Look out!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thanks, Kev.  I'm good though.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Thank you, Hunter. [to Michael and Toby] Hello.  Come in.  [exhales] Ah, Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who's the boy toy?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: That's my new assistant.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Were you going to tell me that you hired James Van Der Beek?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I have to call you the second I get a new assistant?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Be nice to get a memo, we are lovers.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hi, Jan.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Hi, Toby. [clears throat] First-- [Michael clears his throat] First off, Michael, this is a salary negotiation.  All matters regarding our personal relationship have to be set aside.  Are we clear?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pippity poppity.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Right now we can offer you a 6% raise.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Six percent?  After all we've been through?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh, God.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I got you... jade earrings.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael--

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael--

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.  You gonna play it like this?  You give me a good raise, or no more sex. [Toby begins to write] [to Toby] What are you writing, perv-ball?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Just preparing for the deposition.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: This may be the first time that a male subordinate has attempted to get a modest scheduled raise by threatening to withhold sex from a female superior.  It will be a groundbreaking case when it inevitably goes to trial.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: I'm so sorry, Pammy.  I really wasn't gonna do anything.  But then I... kept thinkin' about you two together, and...  I just thought you guys were really good friends, or... or maybe he was gay or somethin'... Not that that's wrong.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm sorry too.  I just, I think that we both made some bad choices.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: So you gonna start datin' Halpert then?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um... no.  No, he has a girlfriend.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Oh yeah... Wait a minute, you... broke off our wedding for the guy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, there were a lot of reasons.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: But you're not even gonna try to go out with him? [Pam meekly shakes her head] I don't get you Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What's this?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What's what?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Certificate of Bravery, from the Scranton Police Department.  "Recognizing outstanding citizenship from a very brave young man.  Dwight K. Schrute"

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow.  I guess word got around.  That's a nice... honor.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Please.  They hand these out to little kids.  Look.  There's a teddy bear in a policeman's cap.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [under his breath] Didn't think you'd notice...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why don't you just take that pen and stab me in the heart.  This is me, Jan.  This is me!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Okay, Michael.  Please, why don't we just take a break.  This is really going nowhere.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, no, no, no, no.  You do not try tactic number eight on me.  I invented tactic number eight.  I'm not going anywhere.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Ok, Toby, how about if you...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What's wrong with you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ohh.  It was a weird day.  I accidentally cross-dressed.  And then Darryl made me feel bad for not making any money.  And then I had to ride up here with stupid Toby.  And then, your assistant, is all young and hot.  And I--

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Okay, Michael.  I can offer you a 12% raise, but you have got to ask for 15.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well that's ridiculous I'm not gonna make--

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No, just... I just need you to ask for it, so I can record that you asked for it.  Okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah, so...  All right, Levinson.  Here's the rub.  I would like a 15% raise.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No.  But we can offer you 12.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: But you just said 15.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Negotiation is an art.  Back and forth.  Give and take.  And today, both Darryl and I took something.  Higher salaries.  Win win win.  But you know, life is about more... than just salaries.  It's about perks.  Like having sex with Jan-

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: So you and Bob are looking at a historical house?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Mm-hmm, near the river.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Mm, how many bedrooms?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Four.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Dwight.  Dwight.  I've been doing some very interesting reading.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.  Tales of bravery.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mm, good stuff.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.  I was thinking tonight, we could... read it together.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Sounds... fun. [they kiss, Jim walks out of the bathroom and sees]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [scoffs] I... will never say a word.  And now, we are even.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I graduated from anger management the same way I graduated from Cornell.  On time.  Now I'm back.  Got a second chance, and I'm not gonna blow it.  [in a forceful voice] So look out Dunder Mifflin!  [laughs] [snaps] I mean, look out... in a fun way!  You know, not like, I'm gonna hurt you...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey guys!  Guess who's back! [Dwight pepper-spray's Andy] AHHH! [screams in pain] OH, GOD!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No need to thank me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I am not a hero.  I am a mere defender of the office.  You know who's a real hero?  Hiro, from Heroes.  That's a hero.  Also, Bono.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Look, I am not a gazillionaire.  I can't... I can't dress like Donald Trump dresses.  I have to stay within the parameters of my budget.  I can't shop at a fancy Norwegian boutique.  I buy my suits the old fashioned way.  I buy them from discount stores... or on eBay.  And when I found out that Ross was having a midnight madness sale, I ran, not walked, as per the instructions on the flier.  And I got there, and when the doors opened, all of these women ran to this one bin.  And I did too.  And I grabbed this suit.  And a woman, sort of a, I don't know, Missy Elliot type, grabbed the jacket.  And, uh, we had kind of a heated tug of war.  And I could tell by the way she was screaming that this must be a get.  And I figured she was just buying it for her husband, to answer your question from before.  Um, anyway, she s... socked me, in the eye.  And she got it, she got the suit.  But, I went to the Ross, in Trenton New Jersey, and I found the exact same suit.  And I didn't have to deal with Missy Elliot.
